title: Swansea Summer Music Series
description:
🎸🎷 Come alive with the Swansea Summer Music Series every Tuesday this August!
Enjoy vibrant performances from a variety of talented musicians under the open sky. These family-friendly evenings are the perfect way for neighbours, friends, and families to connect and unwind. 🌿✨ 
Here’s the musicians lineup: 
~ Aug 5 – Tara Moneka (Arabic Jazz)
~ Aug 12 – Alex Pangman & Colonel Tom (Country, Swing)
~ Aug 19 – Lydia Persaud & Camilo Restrepo (Singer-Songwriter, Solo Guitar)
~ Aug 26 – Michael Shand (Blues, Soul) 
📅 Every Tuesday in August | 6:30–8:30 PM📍 Swansea Town Hall Piazza, 95 Lavinia Ave 
🤝 Bloor West Village BIA is proud to be one of the sponsors. 
🎶 To add the perfect note to your evening, enjoy 15% off at some of our local favourites — Gatto Wood Oven Pizza, Bukhara Grill, Second Cup Cafe, and The Holistic Refinery! Get your exclusive discount vouchers at the event, valid all through August.✨

title: Bloor West Village Community Treasure Hunt: Tastes, Tales & Treasure
description:
📣 Registration is now OPEN! 📣
It’s time to HUNT! Families, friends, and curious minds – are you ready to solve clues, prizes, and a whole lot of fun?🎉
🧩 Join us for a FREE Community Treasure Hunt: Tastes, Tales & Treasure in Bloor West Village.🔍 
📍 Event Details:
🗓️ Saturday, August 16, 2025
🕙 Join anytime between 10AM – 6PM
📍 Start location: BIA Curb Side Patio at 2253 Bloor St W
⏱️ Estimated play time: 1–1.5 hours (play at your own pace) 
🔍 How It Works:
🔗 Register online!
📱 Bring your mobile device on event day
🧩 Solve fun riddles, play games, get exclusive deals from 25+ local shops
🎯 Unlock exclusive deals, treats & surprises as you go 
🏆 Prizes & Surprises:
💰 Complete the hunt for a chance to win the $1,000 cash grand prize!
🎁 One of three registration prizes of $100
✨ One of five social side quests worth $50 
🌟 Special thanks to our amazing Sponsors:
BCU Financial, Gillian Ritchie Red Square Team – Royal LePage, and Tuli Mortgage 
🤝 Presented in Partnership with Treasure Trove Toronto 
Click here to Register now!

title: BWV Toronto Ukrainian Festival
description:
The Bloor West Village Toronto Ukrainian Festival is the annual 3-day street fest that celebrates the vibrant culture of Ukraine. Enjoy captivating performances, savour traditional cuisine and explore a shopping extravaganza featuring our beloved local businesses! 
Stay tuned for more details! 
About the Festival: **Please note, the Festival is organized by a separate third party organization to the Bloor West Village BIA. It has a Board of Directors and a committee of organizers. To reach festival organizers, click here .

title: Summer Splendor: Garden Arts Exhibition
description: Celebrate the height of summer with this special exhibition featuring traditional Chinese garden arts including brush painting, calligraphy, and tea culture. Visitors can enjoy demonstrations and participate in workshops throughout the duration of the exhibition.

venue.name: Dr. Sun Yat-Sen Classical Chinese Garden
venue.description: The Dr. Sun Yat-Sen Classical Chinese Garden is the first Ming Dynasty-style garden built outside of China, offering a window into Chinese culture and history in the heart of Vancouver.

title: Autumn Reflections: Cultural Heritage Exhibition
description: As autumn transforms the garden, this exhibition explores the cultural significance of the season in Chinese tradition. Featuring special displays of chrysanthemums, artwork, and poetry, visitors can learn about the symbolism of autumn in Chinese philosophy and arts.

title:
Garden Dinner: PROVINCE TO PLATE
            
			This month's Province to Plate menu
description:
PROVINCE TO PLATE
            
			This month's Province to Plate menu showcases the very best of the Pacific Northwest with a hyper-local, seasonal three-course experience built in collaboration with our trusted farmers, fishers, and artisans. Spotlighting locally caught halibut, grilled asparagus and featuring a pollinator-friendly dessert inspired by the bees behind so much of the food we enjoy. Made with honey from our rooftop apiary and country hives, it’s a tribute to the small but mighty workers that help bring each harvest to life - and to our ongoing efforts to support pollinator health and habitat.
			
	
		
			
		GET LOCAL


	

		  
          Slide 2 of 8
